channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration.

item.title: Report X-2024070285
item.description:
Report X-2024070285

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-21T00:40:08+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-17
  • City: MCRAE
  • State: AR
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNION PACIFIC RAILROAD COMPANY INC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 45
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 50000
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: Car was found releasing vapor as it went through Beebe, AR and was stopped by the local FD outside McRae, AR. The FD conducted a 1/2-mile evacuation and isolated the area. Upon HMM arrival, we met with the FD and was granted approval to access the car. Upon inspection of the car, liquid was observed releasing from under the valve at the connection of the 4-bolt valve flange to the flanged riser due to all four nuts that secure the valve to the flange not secured. The four nuts were found inside the protective housing. The pressure was removed from the car, the leak stopped, and the four bolts properly secured. The car was neutralized and set out. An OTMA-1 was granted for movement back to the shipper.

item.title: Report E-2024090370
item.description:
Report E-2024090370

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-19T09:21:33+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-16
  • City: EL PASO
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 7000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal LEP experienced a UN1866 Bulldog Adhesion Promoter release from 2 boxes each containing (6) 1-quart metal bottles. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 6 quarts of product released to a 3’ x 5’ area of the trailer floor and a 3’ x 4’ area of the concrete lot below. The cans were damaged as a result of being crushed due to stacking/improper loading. The (8) damaged cans were placed into a 55-gallon metal drum. All impacted cardboard, pads, and absorbents used to clean the spill were placed into a second 55-gallon metal drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • Description: On 9/13/2024 at approximately 2330, Dnagerous Goods Administration received a call from Employee 220288 at the hub facility in Memphis, reporting a dangerous goods spill. The shipment consisted of 30 small cans of paint packaged in a fiberboard box. One of the can had a loose top, resulting in spillage. The shipment was placed in a salvage drum and awaits an amended Shipper's declaration for further transport.

item.title: Report E-2024090347
item.description:
Report E-2024090347

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-19T09:21:33+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-13
  • City: DALLAS
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO-Logistics contacted ERTS regarding a punctured bottle of hazardous product, Instant Power® Heavy Duty Drain Opener. The plastic bottle was punctured by a forklift blade that resulted in the release of approximately 1-gallon of product onto the pallet and wooden trailer floor in an 8’x2’ area. A Contractor neutralized the release using KolorSafe Liquid Neutralizer and applied oil dry. The neutralized impacted pallet was cut-up and containerized into a 95-gallon DF. The neutralized impacted absorbents, PPE, and product were containerized into a 55-gallon DF. XPO will manage the waste until end disposal. No storm-drains, waterways, or soil were involved in this incident.

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-19T09:21:33+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-13
  • City: TYLER
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ABF FREIGHT SYSTEM, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: There were 8 boxes in the shipment each containing 4 cans. One of the boxes appears to have been crushed by freight in transit before arriving to service center 177, but the damage went unnoticed to the customer facility. The customer refused 5 of the 8 boxes due to the damaged can leaking onto the other boxes. It was then noticed that service center 070 noted that the shipment was damaged but did not note the type of damage and sent it on to 177. CURA was contacted for remediation.

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-13
  • City: FLINT
  • State: MI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 9/12/2024 at approximately 1830, Dangerous Goods Administration was notified that a package, classified as UN 3373, shipping under Tracking # 777754911170 was discovered leaking at the ramp facility in Flint, MI. The package was discovered in a documents bag, displaying dampness. The eOps report indicates that the shipment was originally retrieved from a local drop box; however, the cause of the spillage cannot be confirmed. No other packages were affected, as the spillage appeared to be contained inside the documents bag. The spilled package was placed is a salvage drum for proper disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024090369
item.description:
Report E-2024090369

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-19T09:21:33+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-06
  • City: WILMINGTON
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On September 6, 2024, one (1) 5-gallon pail of Swisher Hercules was punctured and released approximately one (1) gallon of product to the dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from First Call Environmental (FCE) to remediate the impacted site. FCE personnel deployed granular absorbents to the Swisher Hercules-impacted dock floor and swept them in with hand tools. Crews neutralized the absorbents and spilled materials and utilized pH test strips. All spent absorbents were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum, and one (1) damaged pail of Swisher Hercules was collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum.

  • Description: At 1236 ET, XPO-UMM notified ERTS of a cargo release. It was reported that approximately 1 cup of UN3077 Curene 442 released from a 30 gallon metal drum due to a forklift accident. The release impacted inside trailer#315-2615. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller and determined that terminal personnel were capable of cleaning the release with PPE available on site. Terminal cleaned the trailer with absorbents. The damaged drum and all impacted absorbents were containerized into a 55-gallon metal drum. The waste was staged on site for terminal personnel to manage.

The spill has impacted the trailer floor and the asphalt of Pilot Travel Center. Contractors arrived on site and confirmed 3-gallons of UN1263 "DURANAR BONE WHITE" product released to 3'x3' area of the trailer floor due to improper loading. Contractors deployed absorbents to the impacted area. The damaged drum was overpacked into a 95-gallon poly waste drum. All impacted absorbents were containerized into a 55-gallon metal drum. The waste was transported to the XPO terminal located in Amarillo, TX for terminal personnel to manage. The waste was staged on site for terminal personnel to manage.

ERTS dispatched a contractor to the site to complete cleanup activities. Contractors arrived on site, neutralized the area, deployed absorbents, and cleaned up the released material from 2'x23' trailer and 2'x10 concrete with impacted acid pads and Sodium Baicarb. Product was transloaded to new metal tote. Damaged tote and drum were staged onsite at the terminal for personnel to manage.

item.title: Report I-2024070152
item.description:
Report I-2024070152

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-19T00:40:34+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-30
  • City: SAN BERNARDINO
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: BNSF RAILWAY COMPANY
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Sequence of Events: On 6/27/2024, the Pressurizer was picked up by BNSF and arrived in Stuart Railyard in Oceanside, California (same day). On 6/30/2024, Pressurizer arrived at the San Bernardino Railyard in California where the leak was discovered by the BNSF rail inspector. On 7/4/2024, Pressurizer transported back to the SONGS Site for repair. Actions Taken at the time it was discovered: Site Emergency Response Team initiated per site procedures. Leak was stopped with the use of JB Weld & Silicon Sealant. Package Failure (including the size and location of holes, cracks, etc.): Manway cover and other sealed openings not completely sealed. Estimate the duration of the release: Two days (very slow leak, approximately <3 liters overall). Mitigation actions (effects of the release): Site investigation identified gaps in the development and implementation of the work package in that no guidance to remediate residual liquids nor re-inspect the pressurizer once it was placed into its shipping configuration to validate residual liquids was still in the pressurizer.

item.title: Report X-2024090943
item.description:
Report X-2024090943

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-18T09:15:04+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-13
  • City: NITRO
  • State: WV
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ABF FREIGHT SYSTEM, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Ellen Crislip, 252 Operations Supervisor, contacted Safety regarding a UN1760 spill to the dock floor. Ellen Crislip advised Safety that while Steve Looney, dock worker, was unloading the freight one box was punctured by the forklift. Ellen Crislip stated a piece of the wood on the pallet broke caus ing the box to fall below the pallet resulting in the box being punctured. Ellen Crislip advised they placed pads down to soak the spill and the box is now upright not leaking. Ellen Crislip stated the dock worker was attempting to clean the spill in house. Safety directed Ellen Crislip to stop the dock worker. Safety stated Cura would need to be contacted for remediation. Ellen Crislip advised Cura to be contacted on straight time since the spill is contained. ~

item.description:
Report X-2024090936

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-18T09:15:04+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-12
  • City: LOUISVILLE
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: AT THE UPS WORLDPORT FACILITY IN LOUISVILLE, KENTUCKY, ONE AIR PACKAGE WAS INSPECTED DUE TO A LABEL ON THE BOX STATING, "BATTERY INSIDE". UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED FOUR LENOVO THINKPADS. TWO OF THE THINKPADS WERE PACKAGED INSIDE LAPTOP BAGS. TWO OF THE THINKPADS WERE PACKED INSIDE THE BOX IN USPS PAD PACKS. THE PACKAGE ALSO CONTAINED TWO LAPTOP CHARGERS AND A LENOVO LAPTOP DOCK. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX.

  • City: SEATTLE

  • Description: On September 6th during the PM sort a box was found that was wet and was compromised. The inside packages were viewable from the water damage and there were two packages inside of the outer package both of them marked as Class 2.2 and Class 5.1 and contained UN1070, Nitrous Oxide, 2.2(5.1). There were no markings on the outside of the outer package to indicate dangerous goods were inside. The packge has been placed inside of a steel salvage drum and is being held pending disposition.

item.description:

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-18T09:15:04+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-05
  • City: MATTESON
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On September 5, 2024, one (1) 1-gallon pail of uN1824 was crushed in transit and released approximately one-half (0.5) gallon of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from HazChem Environmental (HCE) to remediate the impacted site. HCE deployed a bicarbonate/water mixture to the trailer floor to neutralize the product. Granular absorbents were deployed to retrieve all loose product, as well as the bicarbonate/water mixture. All spent absorbents were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum, The damaged product container was placed into one (1) 5-gallon drum.

  • Description: AT THE UPS FACILITY IN OAK CREEK, WISCONSIN, ONE FULLY MARKED AND LABELED DANGEROUS GOODS PACKAGE WAS FOUND LEAKING DURING THE TRAILER UNLOAD. DANGEROUS GOODS SHIPPING PAPERS WERE APPLIED TO THE PACKAGE AND HAD PASSED AN ACCEPTANCE AUDIT AT THE ORIGIN FACILITY IN MICHIGAN. THE PACKAGE CONTAINED SIX X ONE LITER BOTTLES OF VIO NEXUS ANTISEPTIC HAND SANITIZER. ONE BOTTLE WAS LEAKING APPROXIMATLY TEN OUNCES FROM A LOOSE CLOSURE. NO PHOTOS WERE OBTAINED OF THE LEAKING PACKAGE.

item.title: Report E-2024080745
item.description:
Report E-2024080745

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-18T09:15:04+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-22
  • City: WALBRIDGE
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: CSX TRANSPORTATION, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 8/22/2024, at 1353 hours, CSXT personnel at the Walbridge Yard discovered FHRX135943, a loaded tank car of Sulfur, Molten, with a vapor release from the connection between the manway nozzle and the manway cover. The car was isolated and the shipper, Marathon Petroleum Company, was notified via CHEMTREC (Report #2024082200196). CSXT Hazardous Materials Manager Scott Karcher found the manway gasket to be improperly installed (misaligned) which allowed for a vapor release. The damaged gasket was removed, a new gasket was installed, and the manway was secured for transportation. The issue was identified and corrective actions were communicated to the shipper’s representative (Jennifer Johnson 209-986-1196). This incident did require a special switching move. 7.1 is not required.

item.title: Report E-2024090342
item.description:
Report E-2024090342

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-18T09:15:04+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-22
  • City: PHOENIX
  • State: AZ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 55000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 1350 ET, Jeremiah Faustinos with XPO terminal UPH notified ERTS of a cargo release. It was reported that an estimated amount of 2-Gallons of UN3103 Organic Peroxide Type C released due to pressurizing during transit. The release impacted trailer #3233003. No storm drains or waterways are reported to be impacted by the release. ERTS dispatched a contractor to perform cleanup activities. Contractors arrived on site and confirmed approximately 50 gallons of product released to 15'x8.5' area of the trailer floor due to excessive heat. Contractors transferred product, empty jerricans, impacted absorbents to 3 drums, 4 totes and 10 CUYD's. The waste was staged on site for terminal personnel to manage. All liquid product was salvaged and transferred into poly jerricans and sent on to customer.

  • Description: At 2135 ET XPO notified ERTS of a cargo release at terminal XLU. It was reported that approximately 3 gallons of Master Pro Refinishing 5700 was released from a 5-gallon metal pail due to a forklift puncture. The release impacted trailer #3157295. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller and they felt comfortable cleaning up the release with PPE available on-site. The terminal used a 55-gallon drum for waste, which was staged on site for personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2024090337
item.description:
Report E-2024090337

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-18T09:15:04+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-21
  • City: PHOENIX
  • State: AZ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 9000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 18:12 EST on 8/21, XPO-UPH contacted ERTS to report a spill of about 4 ounces of UN1993 "Unisol Liquid Red BK-50" from a 250-gallon metal tote impacting the trailer floor. The tote was discovered with a crack in the body at the bottom of the tote, which was likely damaged during loading at XCN. ERTS dispatched a contractor to assist with cleaning the spill and transferring the remaining liquid to a new tote. The salvage material and leaking tote was transferred into drums for salvage. Contractors arrived on site and confirmed approximately 4 ounces of product impacted the trailer floor due to faulty weld/seam on tote leg. Contractors then containerized to 1 55-gallon drum. The waste was staged on site for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2024090335
item.description:
Report E-2024090335

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-18T09:15:04+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-21
  • City: SACRAMENTO
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 2500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 1558ET, XPO notified ERTS of a cargo release located at terminal USA in Sacramento, CA. It was reported that approximately 1 ounce of UN1760 SHINELINE EMULSIFIER PLUS released from (1) carton containing (4) 1-gallon jugs of product due to the box being crushed by the boxes stacked on top of it. The release impacted the trailer floor, the pallet, and a second carton. ERTS reviewed the SDS and determined that a contractor is necessary due to the corrosivity (Class 8). ERTS dispatched a contractor to perform cleanup activities. Contractors arrived on site and confirmed approximately 1 ounce of product released to 2'x2' area of the trailer floor due to improper loading. Contractors deployed absorbents and sodium bicarb solution to the impacted area to clean and neutralize the release. The damaged bottle impacted cardboard and cleanup debris were containerized to 2–55-gallon poly drums. The waste was staged on site for terminal personnel to manage.

  • Description: At 1045 ET, XPO terminal UPH notified ERTS of a cargo release. It was reported that approximately 7 ounces of Univar Solutions Butyl Acetates UN1123 released from (1)5-gallon metal pail due to metal bar inside of the trailer falling onto cargo. No storm drains or waterways are reported to be impacted by the release. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller and terminal personnel determined they would clean the release with PPE and absorbents available on site. The damaged pail and clean up debris were containerized into a 55-gallon drum, which was staged on site for terminal personnel to manage.

  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO terminal LEP called in to report an 11-gallon spill of UN1993 "Biobor®JF" from a 55-gallon metal drum caused by a forklift puncture that impacted trailer and dock floors. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller and advised that due the respiratory hazards presented by the material, a contractor response is recommended which the caller agreed to. Contactors arrived on site and confirmed approximately 15 gallons released to a 10'x6' area of the concrete dock floor. Absorbents were deployed and worked into the impacted area. The damaged drum was placed into a 95-gallon poly overpack. All absorbents and cleanup debris were containerized into a 55-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged on site for terminal personnel to manage.

  • City: LINWOOD
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Carrier/Reporter: Norfolk Southern
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 1500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Covered hopper car CRDX 970231, loaded with ammonium nitrate prills, was found at Spencer Yard with a failure of the car body during an outbound mechanical inspection. At some point, the car body crumpled and a small tear opened along a bend resulting in approximately 2 pound of ammonium nitrate releasing from the car. An investigation was conducted into the cause of the car failure and no incidents of rough handling or impacts were found. The car arrived at Spencer Yard and was not flat switched while at the yard but moved as a block of cars to an outbound track where the damage was found. The car passed an outbound mechanical inspection at the previous station in Columbia, SC where the car was last switched.

item.title: Report E-2024090293
item.description:
Report E-2024090293

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-18T09:15:04+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-14
  • City: ROANOKE
  • State: VA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal NRO experienced an approximate ten (10) gallons release of UN1760 Hydroco BT-78 from one (1) 20-gallon poly drum impacting the trailer floor and asphalt underneath the trailer. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Upon the contractor’s arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted a 45'X1' area of the trailer floor and a 10'x2' area of the asphalt underneath the trailer. An estimated ten (10) gallons of material was released due to a pallet nail puncture. Contractors overpacked the two drums, neutralized the area, deployed absorbents, and cleaned up the released material. The damaged drum, impacted drum, and recovered material were placed into three (3) 55-gallon poly drums and was staged onsite at the terminal prior to the contractor demobilization.

item.title: Report E-2024090301
item.description:
Report E-2024090301

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-18T09:15:04+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-14
  • City: OSCEOLA
  • State: AR
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 27000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal LJB experienced a customer location and roadside release of UN1819 Xcelerator A38 from a 300-gallon poly tote. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 110-gallons of product released to a 53' x 8' area of the trailer floor, 54' x 8' area of the asphalt roadway, a 54' x 2.5' area of the soil shoulder, and a 30' x 40' area of the customer’s asphalt lot as well as into a storm drain catch basin. Contractors secured the release with absorbents, pads, and boom upon arrival. The crew confirmed the tote was punctured due to improper loading. The material still in the damaged tote was transferred into a new one. Once all free liquid was absorbed, sodium bicarbonate and water were used to rinse the impacted areas to clean and neutralize them. The following day, the crew returned to site with a vac truck and a pressure washer. The impacted catch basin was vacuumed and flushed out. The customer confirmed the pumps were shut off so the material could not migrate from the drains catch basin. The impacted concrete lot at the customers location and the impacted asphalt roadway were then pressure washed, and all material was collected into a vac-truck. Approximately 1300-gallons of impacted wastewater were removed from site pending disposal. (5) 55-gallon poly drums of impacted absorbents, the cut up damaged poly tote, and impacted debris were transported to the XPO Terminal located in Jonesboro, AR for terminal personnel to manage. The impacted soil shoulder was then secured and marked for future remediation.

The drum lid was then replaced properly. the cause of the leak was because the shipper didn't tighten the bolt on the drum enough. The spill was contained and cleanup in house.

item.title: Report X-2024090738
item.description:
Report X-2024090738

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-15T09:12:56+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-11
  • City: CAMP HILL
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ABF FREIGHT SYSTEM, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Cameron Logan Supervisor called safety to report a spill of UN1263, PAINT, 3, PG II. Cameron stated while the forklift operator was loading the pallet of paint, one of the 5-gallon pails on the pallet struck other fright in the trailer puncturing the bottom of one pail on the pallet the forklift was loading. Cameron stated the forklift operator turned the pail on to its top to stop the spill and removed the pallet from the trailer to the dock floor and reported the spill. Cameron stated it looked like the spilled on the trailer floor has dried up and can no longer see where it spilled, and the pallet has dried up as well showing no signs of a spill. Cameron stated it looks like 5oz may have spilled from the pail on the trailer floor and the pallet. Cameron stated he changed out the pallet with the spill with a new pallet for the other 3 pails and placed the damaged pail on the pallet wit h the spill. Cameron stated the spill on the trailer floor and on the pallet has dried and you can no longer see where the spill was and wanted to know what to do with the damaged pail. Safety advised CURA would be called to assist with the spill and the damaged pail.

  • City: CHARLESTON

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: THREE PACKAGES WERE INSPECTED DUE TO A RECENT UNDECLARED DANGEROUS GOODS PACKAGE BEING FOUND FROM THE ACCOUNT HOLDER. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED ONE BOX CONTAINS FOUR X ONE GALLON CANS OF FLAMMABLE CLASSIC EXPRESS STAIN. ADDITIONAL TRACKING NUMBERS TO OTHER CONSIGNEES IN THE USA ARE 1ZJ5H5581227456188 AND 1ZJ5H5581211001868. ADDITIONAL TRACKING NUMBERS EACH CONTAIN SIX X ONE GALLON CANS OF FLAMMABLE CLASSIC EXPRESS STAIN. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOXES. THESE PACKAGES HAVE NOT BEEN ACCEPTED FOR AIR OR TRANSPORTED IN THE AIR BY UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO. THESE PACKAGES WERE SHIPPED FROM SOUTH CAROLINA USING UPS ACCOUNT NUMBER J5H558, WHITE, 4115 DORCHESTER RD, NORTH CHARLESTON SC 29405-7466.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On September 3, 2024, one (1) 5-gallon pail of UN3266 was crushed in transit and released approximately three (3) gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Thin Line Environmental (TLE) to remediate the impacted site. TLE personnel discovered that one (1) 5-gallon pail of UN3266 washer fluid and one (1) 5-gallon pail of non-regulated washer fluid were damaged and released approximately three (3) gallons of product. TLE personnel utilized hand tools, absorbents, and soda ash to remediate the sulfuric acid-impacted impacted dock floor. The damaged pail and all impacted debris were collected and containerized into three (3) 55-gallon drums

  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On September 3, 2024, twelve (12) 1-gallon pails of paint fell in transit and released approximately ten (10) gallons of product to the trailer interior and pavement below. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Environmental Restoration, LLC (ER) to remediate the impacted site. ER deployed granular absorbents to the impacted surfaces and swept them in with hand tools. All absorbent waste and product containers were collected and containerized into four (4) 55-gallon drums and transported to the R+L terminal in Kansas City.

  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On September 3, 2024, one (1) 275-gallon tote of sulfuric acid was punctured by falling freight and released approximately two (2) gallons of product to the trailer interior and surrounding freight. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from First Call Environmental (FCE) to remediate the impacted site. FCE personnel deployed neutralizers and granular absorbents to the sulfuric acid-impacted trailer floor and tote exterior. Crews utilized hand tools to collect and containerize all spent absorbents and neutralizers into one (1) 55-gallon poly drum. FCE performed a gravity tote transfer of the sulfuric acid into one (1) new 330-gallon tote.

  • Description: On 8/31/2024 tank car TILX 135685 was called in with an odor. During the initial assessment, the tank car was found with a manway cover gasket and a nozzle gasket. The cover gasket was deteriorated and cut causing an obstruction and a vapor release. The nozzle gasket showed no signs of issues. The cover gasket was removed as it is not needed when you have a nozzle gasket in place, and because it was damaged. GrayMar Environmental assisted with the response.

  • City: PORTLAND

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0

  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: RESPONDER FOLLOWED DECISION TREE TO RESPOND TO LEAKING PACKAGE IN UNLOAD. RESPONDER BAGAN DMP PROCESS OF LEAKER AND AFFECTED DEBRIS. AFTER CARDBOARD WAS CONTAINERIZED INTO DMP BAG, BAG BEGAN SMOKING AFTER BAG POPPED OPEN. THE SMOKE STOPPED. RESPONDER NOTIFIED RMP. RMP INSTRUCTED CONTENTS TO BE CORDONED OFF OUTSIDE. BAG BEGAN SMOKING A SECOND TIME WHEN OUTSIDE. RMP NOTIFIED SORT MANAGER AND CALLED FOR OUTSIDE RESPONSE TEAM. WHILE BAG WAS OUTSIDE, IT EVENTUALLY CAUGHT FIRE. ALL CONTENTS CONTAINERIZED BY OUTSIDE RESPONSE TEAM AND PLACED IN SHED 2 FOR FWN PROCESSING.

  • Description: XPO-XMI contacted ERTS regarding a leaking 55-gallon DF containing Organic Emitter Clean. A Contractor was dispatched and observed a 0.5-gallon release isolated to the top of the drum as a result of a puncture from a forklift blade. The drum was flipped over in attempt to stop the leak resulting in a product impact to the wooden trailer floor. The Contractor overpacked the damaged and leaking drum into a 95-gallon DF. XPO will manage waste disposal. The impact to the trailer floor evaporated by the time that the contractors attempted to clean it. No storm-drains, waterways, or soil were involved in this incident.

item.description:
Report E-2024090251

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-15T09:12:56+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-27
  • City: HOLBROOK
  • State: AZ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 12000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO Logistics driver domiciled out of UPH (Pheonix, AZ) contacted ERTS regarding the release of Benco Sanding Sealer. A Contractor was dispatched to the driver’s location and observed a 2-gallon release from one 5-gallon PAIL containing Benco Sanding Sealer. The release impacted the wooden trailer floor, the pallet, and the shrink-wrap in a 1’x1’ area. It was concluded that the release was caused by improper blocking and bracing and therefore load-shift during transit. The Contractor overpacked the leaking container along with the impacted debris and absorbents. The waste was taken to XPO-UPH to manage for end disposal. No storm-drains, waterways, or soil were involved in this incident.

item.title: Report E-2024080590
item.description:
Report E-2024080590

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-15T09:12:56+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-17
  • City: MULBERRY
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: CSX TRANSPORTATION, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 7500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On August 17, 2024, at 1400 hours, personnel in the CSXT Mulberry Yard discovered tank car TEIX 3132, loaded with Elevated Temperature Liquid, NOS (Asphalt) appeared to have product adhering to side of tank car. The car was isolated and the shipper, Vertex Energy, was notified via CHEMTREC (Report #2024081700082). Hulls Environmental, a CSXT response contractor, was dispatched to inspect the car. Response personnel confirmed asphalt adhering to side and top of tank car, additionally it was noted that product had released due to an improperly secured manway cover. Specifically, 4 of the 8 manway cover swing bolts not applied; 4 of the 8 manway cover swing bolts were less than tool tight; and the manway cover gasket wis aligned. Contractor personnel inspected and reinstalled the gasket, and properly secured the manway cover for transportation. All hazardous product adhering to the exterior of the tank was removed. The issue identified and corrective actions were communicated to the shipper’s representative (Scott Ehrlich at 281-799-8576).

item.description:
Report E-2024090279

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-15
  • City: BUTTE
  • State: MT
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0

  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 0938 ET, XPO-UBU notified ERTS of a cargo release. It was reported that approximately 1 cup of UN1993 Latrix 6200 released from 55-gallon poly drum due to a pinhole leak. The release impacted just the pallet. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller and determined that terminal personnel were capable of cleaning the release with PPE available on site. The damaged drum and cleanup debris were containerized in 65 poly drum which was staged on site for terminal personnel to manage.

  • Description: At 1455 EST, XPO terminal LTU reported that approximately 2-gallons of UN1263 Diamond Vogal Mult-E-Prime 500 released from (3)1-gallon metal pails due to improper loading. The release impacted trailer # 3212873. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller and determined that terminal personnel were capable of cleaning the release with PPE available on site. Terminal used oil dri to contain the spill and used a 55-gallon poly drum for the waste. The waste was staged on site for terminal personnel to manage.

Upon the contractor’s arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted the cardboard and packaging and estimated that one gallon of material was released. The contractor neutralized the impacted area and then cleaned the released material. The damaged pail was overpacked into one 30-gallon poly drum and the recovered material and spent absorbents were placed into one 55-gallon poly drum and was staged onsite at the terminal prior to the contractor demobilization.   • Description: At 06:39 EST, ERTS was contacted by XPO Logistics (XSW) about a cargo release. It was reported that due to unknown reasons, approximately 3 gallons of G56 Hardener (hazardous - UN1263) was released. The caller stated that the released product was contained to the trailer floor. The caller advised they already cleaned and contained the release. The released product, damaged can, and oil-dri were placed into a 30 gallon metal overpack drum and staged in OS&D. There were no drains, soils or waterways reported to have been impacted by the release.
